elements.content: On the basis of a new topology, a novel yttrium metal–organic framework [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]·xG (TPBTM = N,N′,N″-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide and G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11) has been synthesized and structurally characterized. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group and in its topological net and exists left of the helical rods, which are constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits excellent adsorption capacity for CO2 (130.0 cm3/g at 273 K, 1 bar) and H2 (160.0 cm3/g at 77 K, 1 bar). Remarkably, NJU-Bai11 possesses high H2 adsorption enthalpy (7.05 kJ/mol), which is approaching the highest value (7.3 kJ/mol) reported among rare-earth metal–organic frameworks (RE-MOFs). In addition, a high selectivity ratio of 30.2 for CO2 over N2 makes NJU-Bai11 possess a potential practical application in gas purification.
elements.clean_text: On the basis of a new topology, a novel yttrium metal-organic framework [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]⋅xG (TPBTM = N,N',N"-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide and G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11) has been synthesized and structurally characterized. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group and in its topological net and exists left of the helical rods, which are constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits excellent adsorption capacity for CO2 (130.0 cm3/g at 273 K, 1 bar) and H2 (160.0 cm3/g at 77 K, 1 bar). Remarkably, NJU-Bai11 possesses high H2 adsorption enthalpy (7.05 kJ/mol), which is approaching the highest value (7.3 kJ/mol) reported among rare-earth metal-organic frameworks (RE-MOFs). In addition, a high selectivity ratio of 30.2 for CO2 over N2 makes NJU-Bai11 possess a potential practical application in gas purification.

elements.content: In this work, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal−organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]·xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai’s group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N′,N″-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM). NJU-Bai11 exhibits a new topological net with left helical chains constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with a high BET surface area and CO2 selectivity.
elements.clean_text: In this work, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal-organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]⋅xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai's group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N',N"-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM). NJU-Bai11 exhibits a new topological net with left helical chains constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with a high BET surface area and CO2 selectivity.

elements.content: Microporous metal–organic frameworks (MOFs) have attracted much attention of scientists for their potential application in the fields of energy and the environment. Compared with traditional porous materials, such as zeolite and activated carbon, their superhigh BET surface area, tunable pore size and shape, and functional channel walls make them more advantageous in gas storage and separation. Gas separation, including selective adsorption of CO2 from industrial, natural, and toxic gases removal, from the gases which are generated from power plants, will be a focus of comparable research in energy and the environment of the future.
elements.clean_text: Microporous metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) have attracted much attention of scientists for their potential application in the fields of energy and the environment. Compared with traditional porous materials, such as zeolite and activated carbon, their superhigh BET surface area, tunable pore size and shape, and functional channel walls make them more advantageous in gas storage and separation. Gas separation, including selective adsorption of CO2 from industrial, natural, and toxic gases removal, from the gases which are generated from power plants, will be a focus of comparable research in energy and the environment of the future.

elements.content: Rare earth metal ions possess a high coordination number and flexible coordination geometry. Thus, the structures of coordination complexes based on those metal ions are supposed to be unpredictable but diverse. Due to their ability to form multifunctional hybrid materials, combining their intrinsic porous character with physical properties coming from the rare-earth metal ions, MOFs based on rare-earth metals have attracted more attention and led to more discoveries. Meanwhile, rare-earth metals generally have higher bond energy with oxygen atoms in carboxylate rather than transition metals, because of their high charge density (Z/r) polarizing the O atoms of the carboxylate groups to form strong M–O bonds with significant covalent character. The introduction of rare-earth metals in MOFs is believed to be able to ameliorate the stability of MOFs.
elements.clean_text: Rare earth metal ions possess a high coordination number and flexible coordination geometry. Thus, the structures of coordination complexes based on those metal ions are supposed to be unpredictable but diverse. Due to their ability to form multifunctional hybrid materials, combining their intrinsic porous character with physical properties coming from the rare-earth metal ions, MOFs based on rare-earth metals have attracted more attention and led to more discoveries. Meanwhile, rare-earth metals generally have higher bond energy with oxygen atoms in carboxylate rather than transition metals, because of their high charge density (Z/r) polarizing the O atoms of the carboxylate groups to form strong M-O bonds with significant covalent character. The introduction of rare-earth metals in MOFs is believed to be able to ameliorate the stability of MOFs.

elements.content: Our previous work was focused on designing MOFs based on transition metals such as copper, zinc, and cobalt. Some breakthroughs with improving the CO2 selectivity of MOFs have been made by inserting bridging acylamide groups and shifting coordination sites of ligands. In order to expand our work on exploring more fascinating MOFs with novel structures and multiple properties, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal–organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]·xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai’s group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N′,N″-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM), which we have reported. Intriguingly, the introduction of Y(III) ions leads to the form of helical chains and the chiral character of the whole structure in NJU-Bai11. Therefore, NJU-Bai11 possesses a chiral space group of P212121 and a new topological net that contains left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. The BET surface area of NJU-Bai11 is 1152.1 m2/g, which is among the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) reported for RE-MOFs. The CO2 and H2 uptake amounts of NJU-Bai11 at 1 bar are quite high, with values of 130.0 cm3/g (273 K) and 160.0 cm3/g (77 K), respectively. And the CO2 separation ratios of NJU-Bai11 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively, at 273 K.
elements.clean_text: Our previous work was focused on designing MOFs based on transition metals such as copper, zinc, and cobalt. Some breakthroughs with improving the CO2 selectivity of MOFs have been made by inserting bridging acylamide groups and shifting coordination sites of ligands. In order to expand our work on exploring more fascinating MOFs with novel structures and multiple properties, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal-organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]⋅xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai's group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N',N"-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM), which we have reported. Intriguingly, the introduction of Y(III) ions leads to the form of helical chains and the chiral character of the whole structure in NJU-Bai11. Therefore, NJU-Bai11 possesses a chiral space group of P212121 and a new topological net that contains left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. The BET surface area of NJU-Bai11 is 1152.1 m2/g, which is among the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) reported for RE-MOFs. The CO2 and H2 uptake amounts of NJU-Bai11 at 1 bar are quite high, with values of 130.0 cm3/g (273 K) and 160.0 cm3/g (77 K), respectively. And the CO2 separation ratios of NJU-Bai11 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively, at 273 K.

elements.content: Single crystal X-ray crystallographic analysis reveals that NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral orthorhombic P212121 space group, consisting of two kinds of seven-coordinated Y(III) ions, which were coordinated to TPBTM ligands and water molecules in an asymmetric unit (Figure a and Figures S1 and S2 of the ). In every TPBTM ligand, the dihedral angles of the central benzene ring with three terminal benzene rings are 4.82°, 72.37°, and 63.94°, respectively. As shown in Figure S2 of the , each central Y(III) ion coordinates to seven oxygen atoms from five carboxylate groups of TPBTM ligands and one terminal water molecule. The larger torsion dihedral angles in the ligand and the relatively lower coordination number of the Y(III) ion are probably due to a big steric hindrance of the terminal groups in the ligand. However, the lower coordination number of the central ions may provide potential Lewis acid active sites, which would enhance the interaction between framework and gas molecules.
elements.clean_text: Single crystal X-ray crystallographic analysis reveals that NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral orthorhombic P212121 space group, consisting of two kinds of seven-coordinated Y(III) ions, which were coordinated to TPBTM ligands and water molecules in an asymmetric unit (Figure a and Figures S1 and S2 of the ). In every TPBTM ligand, the dihedral angles of the central benzene ring with three terminal benzene rings are 4.82°, 72.37°, and 63.94°, respectively. As shown in Figure S2 of the , each central Y(III) ion coordinates to seven oxygen atoms from five carboxylate groups of TPBTM ligands and one terminal water molecule. The larger torsion dihedral angles in the ligand and the relatively lower coordination number of the Y(III) ion are probably due to a big steric hindrance of the terminal groups in the ligand. However, the lower coordination number of the central ions may provide potential Lewis acid active sites, which would enhance the interaction between framework and gas molecules.

elements.content: (a) Three-dimensional (3D) framework of NJU-Bai11 with a homochiral structure along the a axis (hydrogen atoms are removed for clarity). (b) Left helical chain constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. (c) The simplification of TPBTM. (d) The topology of NJU-Bai11. Y(1) is the blue pyramid, and Y(2) is the green pyramid.
elements.clean_text: 1  (a) Three-dimensional (3D) framework of NJU-Bai11 with a homochiral structure along the a axis (hydrogen atoms are removed for clarity). (b) Left helical chain constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. (c) The simplification of TPBTM. (d) The topology of NJU-Bai11. Y(1) is the blue pyramid, and Y(2) is the green pyramid.

elements.content: The TPBTM ligand acts as a μ10-bridge, linking to ten Y3+ ions, in which two carboxylate groups adopt a μ1-η1:η1-bridging mode and four μ2-η1:η1-bridging modes, respectively (Figure S1 of the ). The structure of NJU-Bai11 is an interesting 3D net, assembled by carboxyl bridged helices (Figure a). The carboxyl groups from TPBTM ligands initially bridge the Y3+ ions into a left helical chain along the a axis with [Y(1)...(O–C–O)...Y(2)...(O–C–O)] n , being provided with the distance of Y(1)/Y(2) and Y(2)/Y(1) being 5.035 Å and 4.996 Å, respectively (Figure b). Each Y(III) ion is bridged by six oxygen atoms from five carboxylate groups. The screw pitch of the helix is 14.459 Å (Figure b). In the bc plane, each helix is linked to eight neighboring helices by TPBTM ligands to form a 3D network. Meanwhile, each TPBTM ligand links to four helical chains (Figure , panels a–d). Water molecules coordinate to Y(III) ions as terminal ligands. There are open channels along the a direction in NJU-Bai11, with the diameter of about 8 Å (excluding van der Waals radii) (Figure S3 of the ). In accordance with the classification of the Reticular Chemistry Structure Resource and the simplification of rod MOFs, TPBTM can be simplified as shown in Figure c, and the overall structure of NJU-Bai11 can be simplified to a new chiral 6-nodal net (Figure d) with a Schläfli symbol of (3·92)(310·411·56·6)(32·4·93)(38·48·54·6)(93). In this simplified method, the left helical chain is transformed to the helical rod constructed by edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms.
elements.clean_text: The TPBTM ligand acts as a μ10-bridge, linking to ten Y3+ ions, in which two carboxylate groups adopt a μ1-η1:η1-bridging mode and four μ2-η1:η1-bridging modes, respectively (Figure S1 of the ). The structure of NJU-Bai11 is an interesting 3D net, assembled by carboxyl bridged helices (Figure a). The carboxyl groups from TPBTM ligands initially bridge the Y3+ ions into a left helical chain along the a axis with [Y(1)...(O-C-O)...Y(2)...(O-C-O)] n , being provided with the distance of Y(1)/Y(2) and Y(2)/Y(1) being 5.035 Å and 4.996 Å, respectively (Figure b). Each Y(III) ion is bridged by six oxygen atoms from five carboxylate groups. The screw pitch of the helix is 14.459 Å (Figure b). In the bc plane, each helix is linked to eight neighboring helices by TPBTM ligands to form a 3D network. Meanwhile, each TPBTM ligand links to four helical chains (Figure , panels a-d). Water molecules coordinate to Y(III) ions as terminal ligands. There are open channels along the a direction in NJU-Bai11, with the diameter of about 8 Å (excluding van der Waals radii) (Figure S3 of the ). In accordance with the classification of the Reticular Chemistry Structure Resource and the simplification of rod MOFs, TPBTM can be simplified as shown in Figure c, and the overall structure of NJU-Bai11 can be simplified to a new chiral 6-nodal net (Figure d) with a Schläfli symbol of (3⋅92)(310⋅411⋅56⋅6)(32⋅4⋅93)(38⋅48⋅54⋅6)(93). In this simplified method, the left helical chain is transformed to the helical rod constructed by edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms.

elements.content: (a) N2 adsorption isotherm of NJU-Bai11 at 77 K. (b) CO2, CH4, and N2 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai11 at 273 K. (c) H2 adsorption isotherm of NJU-Bai11 at 77 K.
elements.clean_text: 2  (a) N2 adsorption isotherm of NJU-Bai11 at 77 K. (b) CO2, CH4, and N2 adsorption isotherms of NJU-Bai11 at 273 K. (c) H2 adsorption isotherm of NJU-Bai11 at 77 K.

elements.content: To confirm the porosity of NJU-Bai11, the ethanol solvent-exchanged sample was degassed under high vacuum at 60 °C for 12 h. N2 adsorption for NJU-Bai11 at 77 K exhibits a reversible type-I isotherm (Figure a), which is the characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area is ∼1152 m2/g (Langmuir surface area, 1293 m2/g), which is comparable to the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) ever reported in RE-MOFs.
elements.clean_text: To confirm the porosity of NJU-Bai11, the ethanol solvent-exchanged sample was degassed under high vacuum at 60 °C for 12 h. N2 adsorption for NJU-Bai11 at 77 K exhibits a reversible type-I isotherm (Figure a), which is the characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) surface area is ~1152 m2/g (Langmuir surface area, 1293 m2/g), which is comparable to the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) ever reported in RE-MOFs.

elements.content: Furthermore, CO2, CH4, and N2 low-pressure adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 and 298 K. As shown in Figure b, at 273 K, the uptake amounts of CO2, CH4, and N2 are 130.0 cm3/g, 31.2 cm3/g, and 4.9 cm3/g, respectively. This high CO2 sorption capacity (25.5 wt %) at 1 bar for NJU-Bai11 is higher than some typical MOFs, such as SNU-4 (20.6 wt %), ZIF-20 (12.4 wt %), UOC-1 (8.1 wt %), and IRMOF-1 (6.2 wt %). The large discrepancy on adsorption between CO2 and other gases encourages us to evaluate the selectivity of CO2 over N2 and CH4. Herein, we employ initial slopes ratio as its separation ratio, which has been widely adopted by researchers. The separation ratios of CO2 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively. The CO2 selectivity of NJU-Bai11 is the highest value among the reported RE-MOFs under the same condition. As the size of the open channel (8 Å) along the a direction is much bigger than that of gas molecules, such as CO2 (3.3 Å), CH4 (3.8 Å), and N2 (3.64 Å), no molecule sieving effect exists in NJU-Bai11. Thus, the selectivity of CO2 could mainly be attributed to the preferable affinity of the inserted alkylamide group in the structure with CO2 rather than CH4 and N2, which we have proved in our previous work.
elements.clean_text: Furthermore, CO2, CH4, and N2 low-pressure adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 and 298 K. As shown in Figure b, at 273 K, the uptake amounts of CO2, CH4, and N2 are 130.0 cm3/g, 31.2 cm3/g, and 4.9 cm3/g, respectively. This high CO2 sorption capacity (25.5 wt %) at 1 bar for NJU-Bai11 is higher than some typical MOFs, such as SNU-4 (20.6 wt %), ZIF-20 (12.4 wt %), UOC-1 (8.1 wt %), and IRMOF-1 (6.2 wt %). The large discrepancy on adsorption between CO2 and other gases encourages us to evaluate the selectivity of CO2 over N2 and CH4. Herein, we employ initial slopes ratio as its separation ratio, which has been widely adopted by researchers. The separation ratios of CO2 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively. The CO2 selectivity of NJU-Bai11 is the highest value among the reported RE-MOFs under the same condition. As the size of the open channel (8 Å) along the a direction is much bigger than that of gas molecules, such as CO2 (3.3 Å), CH4 (3.8 Å), and N2 (3.64 Å), no molecule sieving effect exists in NJU-Bai11. Thus, the selectivity of CO2 could mainly be attributed to the preferable affinity of the inserted alkylamide group in the structure with CO2 rather than CH4 and N2, which we have proved in our previous work.

elements.content: To better evaluate the interactions between frameworks and CO2 molecules, the isosteric heat (Q st) of CO2 adsorption was calculated by the virial method, using experimental isotherm data at 273 and 298 K. The adsorption enthalpy for NJU-Bai11 is ca. 30.3 kJ/mol at zero loading (Figure S13 of the ), which is higher than NJU-Bai4 (26.3 kJ/mol), Er2(PDA)3 (30 kJ/mol), MAF-25 (26 kJ/mol), CuBTTri (21 KJ/mol), MOF-253 (23 kJ/mol), and NOTT-140 (24.7 kJ/mol). To some extent, the strong CO2-framework interaction demonstrated the good affinity between CO2 molecules and the acylamide groups in the ligands; that may be the reason that the CO2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a hysteresis loop.
elements.clean_text: To better evaluate the interactions between frameworks and CO2 molecules, the isosteric heat (Q st) of CO2 adsorption was calculated by the virial method, using experimental isotherm data at 273 and 298 K. The adsorption enthalpy for NJU-Bai11 is ca. 30.3 kJ/mol at zero loading (Figure S13 of the ), which is higher than NJU-Bai4 (26.3 kJ/mol), Er2(PDA)3 (30 kJ/mol), MAF-25 (26 kJ/mol), CuBTTri (21 KJ/mol), MOF-253 (23 kJ/mol), and NOTT-140 (24.7 kJ/mol). To some extent, the strong CO2-framework interaction demonstrated the good affinity between CO2 molecules and the acylamide groups in the ligands; that may be the reason that the CO2 adsorption isotherm exhibits a hysteresis loop.

elements.content: Additionally, hydrogen adsorption was measured at 77 and 87 K. The adsorption isotherm exhibits that NJU-Bai11 can take up a moderate amount of hydrogen at 1 bar and 77 K [160.0 cm3/g (STP), 1.43 wt %] (Figure c), just lower than Y(BTC)(H2O)·4.3H2O (the highest hydrogen uptake LOF). Meanwhile, based on the isotherms measured at 77 and 87 K, the H2 adsorption enthalpy of NJU-Bai11 is calculated to be 7.05 kJ/mol (Figure S13 of the ), which is approachable to the highest value of Y(BTC)(H2O)·4.3H2O (7.3 kJ/mol), among all of the RE-MOFs.
elements.clean_text: Additionally, hydrogen adsorption was measured at 77 and 87 K. The adsorption isotherm exhibits that NJU-Bai11 can take up a moderate amount of hydrogen at 1 bar and 77 K [160.0 cm3/g (STP), 1.43 wt %] (Figure c), just lower than Y(BTC)(H2O)⋅4.3H2O (the highest hydrogen uptake LOF). Meanwhile, based on the isotherms measured at 77 and 87 K, the H2 adsorption enthalpy of NJU-Bai11 is calculated to be 7.05 kJ/mol (Figure S13 of the ), which is approachable to the highest value of Y(BTC)(H2O)⋅4.3H2O (7.3 kJ/mol), among all of the RE-MOFs.

elements.content: Being aware of the potential applications of RE-MOFs as luminescent materials, we also investigated the photoluminescent properties of H6TPBTM and NJU-Bai11, as shown in Figure and Figure S14 of the . Excited at 343 and 387 nm at room temperature, H6TPBTM and NJU-Bai11 exhibit a broad emission band at 423 and 426 nm, respectively, which can be ascribed to the intraligand π to π* transition. Interestingly, compared with that of H6TPBTM, the excitation band of NJU-Bai11 has a red shift of 44 nm and becomes much closer to the visible area, which is attributed to the influence of the coordination effect between ligands and metal ions. This interesting property would increase the possibility of application in biological systems, which are more vulnerable to damage from ultraviolet radiation.
elements.clean_text: Being aware of the potential applications of RE-MOFs as luminescent materials, we also investigated the photoluminescent properties of H6TPBTM and NJU-Bai11, as shown in Figure  and Figure S14 of the . Excited at 343 and 387 nm at room temperature, H6TPBTM and NJU-Bai11 exhibit a broad emission band at 423 and 426 nm, respectively, which can be ascribed to the intraligand π to π* transition. Interestingly, compared with that of H6TPBTM, the excitation band of NJU-Bai11 has a red shift of 44 nm and becomes much closer to the visible area, which is attributed to the influence of the coordination effect between ligands and metal ions. This interesting property would increase the possibility of application in biological systems, which are more vulnerable to damage from ultraviolet radiation.

elements.content: Luminescence excitation and emission spectra of NJU-Bai 11 in the solid state at room temperature.
elements.clean_text: 3  Luminescence excitation and emission spectra of NJU-Bai 11 in the solid state at room temperature.

elements.content: In summary, we have successfully synthesized a novel topological RE-MOF NJU-Bai11 with an acylamide-functionalized ligand. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group of P212121 and exhibits a new topological net with left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. Meanwhile, NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with the BET surface area of 1152.1 m2/g and high CO2 selectivity. The photoluminescent properties of NJU-Bai11 exhibit strong blue luminescent emissions excited at 387 nm. Our studies presented herein suggest that compound NJU-Bai11 is a useful and promising multifunctional material for both gas separation and luminescence.
elements.clean_text: In summary, we have successfully synthesized a novel topological RE-MOF NJU-Bai11 with an acylamide-functionalized ligand. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group of P212121 and exhibits a new topological net with left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. Meanwhile, NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with the BET surface area of 1152.1 m2/g and high CO2 selectivity. The photoluminescent properties of NJU-Bai11 exhibit strong blue luminescent emissions excited at 387 nm. Our studies presented herein suggest that compound NJU-Bai11 is a useful and promising multifunctional material for both gas separation and luminescence.

cln_elements.content:
On the basis of a new topology, a novel yttrium metal–organic framework [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]·xG (TPBTM = N,N′,N″-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide and G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11) has been synthesized and structurally characterized. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group and in its topological net and exists left of the helical rods, which are constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits excellent adsorption capacity for CO2 (130.0 cm3/g at 273 K, 1 bar) and H2 (160.0 cm3/g at 77 K, 1 bar). Remarkably, NJU-Bai11 possesses high H2 adsorption enthalpy (7.05 kJ/mol), which is approaching the highest value (7.3 kJ/mol) reported among rare-earth metal–organic frameworks (RE-MOFs). In addition, a high selectivity ratio of 30.2 for CO2 over N2 makes NJU-Bai11 possess a potential practical application in gas purification.

Our previous work was focused on designing MOFs based on transition metals such as copper, zinc, and cobalt. Some breakthroughs with improving the CO2 selectivity of MOFs have been made by inserting bridging acylamide groups and shifting coordination sites of ligands. In order to expand our work on exploring more fascinating MOFs with novel structures and multiple properties, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal–organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]·xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai’s group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N′,N″-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM), which we have reported. Intriguingly, the introduction of Y(III) ions leads to the form of helical chains and the chiral character of the whole structure in NJU-Bai11. Therefore, NJU-Bai11 possesses a chiral space group of P212121 and a new topological net that contains left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. The BET surface area of NJU-Bai11 is 1152.1 m2/g, which is among the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) reported for RE-MOFs. The CO2 and H2 uptake amounts of NJU-Bai11 at 1 bar are quite high, with values of 130.0 cm3/g (273 K) and 160.0 cm3/g (77 K), respectively. And the CO2 separation ratios of NJU-Bai11 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively, at 273 K.

To confirm the porosity of NJU-Bai11, the ethanol solvent-exchanged sample was degassed under high vacuum at 60 °C for 12 h. N2 adsorption for NJU-Bai11 at 77 K exhibits a reversible type-I isotherm (Figure a), which is the characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent Brunauer–Emmett–Teller (BET) surface area is ∼1152 m2/g (Langmuir surface area, 1293 m2/g), which is comparable to the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) ever reported in RE-MOFs.

Furthermore, CO2, CH4, and N2 low-pressure adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 and 298 K. As shown in Figure b, at 273 K, the uptake amounts of CO2, CH4, and N2 are 130.0 cm3/g, 31.2 cm3/g, and 4.9 cm3/g, respectively. This high CO2 sorption capacity (25.5 wt %) at 1 bar for NJU-Bai11 is higher than some typical MOFs, such as SNU-4 (20.6 wt %), ZIF-20 (12.4 wt %), UOC-1 (8.1 wt %), and IRMOF-1 (6.2 wt %). The large discrepancy on adsorption between CO2 and other gases encourages us to evaluate the selectivity of CO2 over N2 and CH4. Herein, we employ initial slopes ratio as its separation ratio, which has been widely adopted by researchers. The separation ratios of CO2 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively. The CO2 selectivity of NJU-Bai11 is the highest value among the reported RE-MOFs under the same condition. As the size of the open channel (8 Å) along the a direction is much bigger than that of gas molecules, such as CO2 (3.3 Å), CH4 (3.8 Å), and N2 (3.64 Å), no molecule sieving effect exists in NJU-Bai11. Thus, the selectivity of CO2 could mainly be attributed to the preferable affinity of the inserted alkylamide group in the structure with CO2 rather than CH4 and N2, which we have proved in our previous work.

Additionally, hydrogen adsorption was measured at 77 and 87 K. The adsorption isotherm exhibits that NJU-Bai11 can take up a moderate amount of hydrogen at 1 bar and 77 K [160.0 cm3/g (STP), 1.43 wt %] (Figure c), just lower than Y(BTC)(H2O)·4.3H2O (the highest hydrogen uptake LOF). Meanwhile, based on the isotherms measured at 77 and 87 K, the H2 adsorption enthalpy of NJU-Bai11 is calculated to be 7.05 kJ/mol (Figure S13 of the ), which is approachable to the highest value of Y(BTC)(H2O)·4.3H2O (7.3 kJ/mol), among all of the RE-MOFs.

In summary, we have successfully synthesized a novel topological RE-MOF NJU-Bai11 with an acylamide-functionalized ligand. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group of P212121 and exhibits a new topological net with left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. Meanwhile, NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with the BET surface area of 1152.1 m2/g and high CO2 selectivity. The photoluminescent properties of NJU-Bai11 exhibit strong blue luminescent emissions excited at 387 nm. Our studies presented herein suggest that compound NJU-Bai11 is a useful and promising multifunctional material for both gas separation and luminescence.
cln_elements.clean_text:
On the basis of a new topology, a novel yttrium metal-organic framework [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]⋅xG (TPBTM = N,N',N"-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide and G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11) has been synthesized and structurally characterized. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group and in its topological net and exists left of the helical rods, which are constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. NJU-Bai11 exhibits excellent adsorption capacity for CO2 (130.0 cm3/g at 273 K, 1 bar) and H2 (160.0 cm3/g at 77 K, 1 bar). Remarkably, NJU-Bai11 possesses high H2 adsorption enthalpy (7.05 kJ/mol), which is approaching the highest value (7.3 kJ/mol) reported among rare-earth metal-organic frameworks (RE-MOFs). In addition, a high selectivity ratio of 30.2 for CO2 over N2 makes NJU-Bai11 possess a potential practical application in gas purification.

Our previous work was focused on designing MOFs based on transition metals such as copper, zinc, and cobalt. Some breakthroughs with improving the CO2 selectivity of MOFs have been made by inserting bridging acylamide groups and shifting coordination sites of ligands. In order to expand our work on exploring more fascinating MOFs with novel structures and multiple properties, we successfully synthesized a new rare-earth metal-organic framework (RE-MOF) of [Y2(TPBTM)(H2O)2]⋅xG, (G = guest molecule) (NJU-Bai11, where NJU-Bai is an abbreviation for Nanjing University Bai's group), based on an acylamide-functionalized ligand N,N',N"-tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide (H6TPBTM), which we have reported. Intriguingly, the introduction of Y(III) ions leads to the form of helical chains and the chiral character of the whole structure in NJU-Bai11. Therefore, NJU-Bai11 possesses a chiral space group of P212121 and a new topological net that contains left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra with points of extension as carboxylic carbon atoms along the a axis. The BET surface area of NJU-Bai11 is 1152.1 m2/g, which is among the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) reported for RE-MOFs. The CO2 and H2 uptake amounts of NJU-Bai11 at 1 bar are quite high, with values of 130.0 cm3/g (273 K) and 160.0 cm3/g (77 K), respectively. And the CO2 separation ratios of NJU-Bai11 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively, at 273 K. 

To confirm the porosity of NJU-Bai11, the ethanol solvent-exchanged sample was degassed under high vacuum at 60 °C for 12 h. N2 adsorption for NJU-Bai11 at 77 K exhibits a reversible type-I isotherm (Figure a), which is the characteristic of microporous materials. The estimated apparent Brunauer-Emmett-Teller (BET) surface area is ~1152 m2/g (Langmuir surface area, 1293 m2/g), which is comparable to the largest surface area (ranging from 1030 to 1330 m2/g) ever reported in RE-MOFs. 

Furthermore, CO2, CH4, and N2 low-pressure adsorption isotherms were measured at 273 and 298 K. As shown in Figure b, at 273 K, the uptake amounts of CO2, CH4, and N2 are 130.0 cm3/g, 31.2 cm3/g, and 4.9 cm3/g, respectively. This high CO2 sorption capacity (25.5 wt %) at 1 bar for NJU-Bai11 is higher than some typical MOFs, such as SNU-4 (20.6 wt %), ZIF-20 (12.4 wt %), UOC-1 (8.1 wt %), and IRMOF-1 (6.2 wt %). The large discrepancy on adsorption between CO2 and other gases encourages us to evaluate the selectivity of CO2 over N2 and CH4. Herein, we employ initial slopes ratio as its separation ratio, which has been widely adopted by researchers. The separation ratios of CO2 over N2 and CH4 are 30.2 and 6.4, respectively. The CO2 selectivity of NJU-Bai11 is the highest value among the reported RE-MOFs under the same condition. As the size of the open channel (8 Å) along the a direction is much bigger than that of gas molecules, such as CO2 (3.3 Å), CH4 (3.8 Å), and N2 (3.64 Å), no molecule sieving effect exists in NJU-Bai11. Thus, the selectivity of CO2 could mainly be attributed to the preferable affinity of the inserted alkylamide group in the structure with CO2 rather than CH4 and N2, which we have proved in our previous work. 

Additionally, hydrogen adsorption was measured at 77 and 87 K. The adsorption isotherm exhibits that NJU-Bai11 can take up a moderate amount of hydrogen at 1 bar and 77 K [160.0 cm3/g (STP), 1.43 wt %] (Figure c), just lower than Y(BTC)(H2O)⋅4.3H2O (the highest hydrogen uptake LOF). Meanwhile, based on the isotherms measured at 77 and 87 K, the H2 adsorption enthalpy of NJU-Bai11 is calculated to be 7.05 kJ/mol (Figure S13 of the ), which is approachable to the highest value of Y(BTC)(H2O)⋅4.3H2O (7.3 kJ/mol), among all of the RE-MOFs. 

In summary, we have successfully synthesized a novel topological RE-MOF NJU-Bai11 with an acylamide-functionalized ligand. NJU-Bai11 crystallizes in a chiral space group of P212121 and exhibits a new topological net with left helical rods constituted from edge-sharing pyramidal polyhedra along the a axis. Meanwhile, NJU-Bai11 exhibits a high porosity, with the BET surface area of 1152.1 m2/g and high CO2 selectivity. The photoluminescent properties of NJU-Bai11 exhibit strong blue luminescent emissions excited at 387 nm. Our studies presented herein suggest that compound NJU-Bai11 is a useful and promising multifunctional material for both gas separation and luminescence.

metadata.title:
High CO2/N2 Selectivity and
H2 Adsorption of a Novel Porous Yttrium Metal–Organic
Framework Based on N,N′,N″-Tris(isophthalyl)-1,3,5-benzenetricarboxamide
